textBeforeTable: The cookies we use are: Please note that if you block cookies, some features on the CarbonSports GmbH website may be unavailable, and the site may not be fully functional. If you do not know how to change your browser’s settings, or how to delete cookies, please read your browser’s instructions. If you wish to block cookies from third parties (or change your mind later), you can consult the appropriate options on the following website: http://www.omniture.com/en/privacy/policy#optout Use the slider to choose the setting you prefer. Click the “Privacy” tab. Click “Tools” followed by “Internet Options.” You can accept or block all cookies from all websites you visit by changing your Web browser settings. For example, if you use Internet Explorer Version 8.0, the procedure is this: These data are stored separately from any other data you may have provided to us. There is no linkage between these data and your other data; they are analyzed for statistical purposes to help us optimize our website and our products and services. The data are deleted after they are analyzed. Search words via which you found our site Your screen resolution The date and time of your visit Your Internet service provider Your language setting The operating system you are using The website you came to us from (referrer URL) Browser plug ins Browser type and version Your internet address (IP address), minus the last digit, so that your IP address
textAfterTable: This site uses Piwik, an open source Web analysis tool (http://de.piwik.org), to gather and store data for marketing and optimization purposes. These data can be used to generate usage profiles under a pseudonym. Cookies may be used for this purpose. Cookies are small text files that are stored locally in the buffer memory of a visitor’s Web browser and make it possible to recognize the visitor’s browser on return visits. The data gathered with Piwik are not used to identify visitors to this site personally, and they are not combined with personal data maintained under a pseudonym. § 4 USING THE SHARE BUTTON FOR SOCIAL NETWORKS (FACEBOOK, TWITTER) 4.1 Facebook: The Facebook “Share” Button We provide a Facebook button. If you visit a page on our site and click the Facebook button, your browser will connect directly to the servers of the Facebook social network operated by Facebook Inc., 1601 S. California Avenue, Palo Alto, CA 94304, USA (“Facebook”). Facebook will then receive the information that your browser has gone to that particular page of our site, even if you have no Facebook account. That information (including your IP address) will be sent by your browser directly to a Facebook server in the USA and stored there.
